headline: Democrats defend ongoing investigations of President Trump
subHeadline: House Democrats schedule vote to hold Attorney General William Barr in contempt; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: This is a Fox News alert. Authorities say shots have been fired at a school just outside of Denver, Colorado. The Douglas County Sheriff's Office says it believes two people have been injured but they are still gathering information. The sheriff reportedly describing the situation as unstable and is asking the public to avoid the area.  We are monitoring that breaking news and we'll bring you the details as they come.  Meantime, hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Dagen McDowell, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. He's back. It's five o'clock in New York City. And this is “The Five.”  Turning now to our other top story. Tensions rising between the White House and congressional Democrats who are now threatening Trump officials with contempt. The House Judiciary Committee set to vote tomorrow on a contempt citation against Attorney General Bill Barr. Democrats are demanding that Barr hand over in unredacted version of the Mueller report and calls starting for Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin to be held in contempt for refusing to hand over the president's tax return.  Meanwhile, the administration is ordering former White House counsel Don McGahn not to comply with a Congressional subpoena for documents related to the Russia investigation. And all of this comes as a new report says, get this, House Democrats are threatening to withhold salaries of Trump administration officials if they block ongoing committee investigations. Despite claims of overreach from Republicans, Democrats are defending their multiple probes.

utterances.speaker: SEN. MAZIE HIRONO, D-HI
utterances.sentences: As members of Congress, we have a responsibility to oversee what this White House and tis administration is doing. And I can only hope that as the months go by, that the American people will wake up to the fact that our democracy is in danger.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CHUCK SCHUMER, D-N.Y., MINORITY LEADER
utterances.sentences: So, our leader says let's move on. It's sort of like Richard Nixon saying let's move on at the height of the investigation of his wrongdoing. Of course, he wants to move on. He wants to cover up.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF., SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE
utterances.sentences: We are about getting the truth to the American people. The truth is what we want to base our decisions on. And the administration should be willing to share that unless they have something to hide.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Then you've got the media blasting Republicans for defending the president.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: You look at Barr. You look at Pompeo. He has now surrounded himself with the most duplicitous cabinet in recent American history. It's shameful.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: They want a one-party state. That is what the GOP seeks and Trump wants to be an autocrat with that state behind him.

utterances.speaker: JOY BEHAR, HOST, ABC
utterances.sentences: How is it that the Republican Party, your colleagues, can stand by this man when he is involved in this way with Russia? I mean, I've said last week that I don't want to see any of those flag pins anymore on Republicans who don't stand up against this guy for Russian meddling and other things that he's done. It seems as though he's unpatriotic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Where to even begin? Greg Gutfeld, let's go to you. McConnell today spoke for the first time really, give a long speech and said case closed, and edition to move on. And then it was funny to watch Chuck Schumer complain about that because move on comes from?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Moveon.org.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which came from the whole point of moving on from the Clinton scandals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: you know, the Dems are desperate. They're like a tiny little army faced with a dwindling patch of turf to defend. Because remember how big the threat was a couple of years ago? Trump was insane, he was racist, he was a threat of the world safety and the economy. Now you've the greatest economy in 50 years, low unemployment. What do they have? What are they clinging to? Tax returns and their feelings are hurt over the Mueller report which they asked for and they got. By the way, if you're going to scream about cover-up and conspiracy, stick to stuff like JFK or space aliens. Not something that's publicly available. It's really hard to call it a cover-up when something is publicly available. You morons.  You what this reminds me of? It reminds me of growing up watching the Harlem Globetrotters play the Washington Generals. Right? Trump is the Harlem Globetrotters and the media and the Democrats are the Washington Generals. They can only respond helplessly against the strange phenomenon that continually wins.  And they never adjust or adapt to play against the Harlem Globetrotters because they just lose every time. Imagine a group of people cultists who demanded you adhere to their delusions or they will punish you. That's what's going on right now. They are demanding. You, the media, The View, all this morning what's his face, are basically belonging to a pagan religion in which they adhere to some kind of emotional belief that goes against all the facts, low unemployment among minorities, among women. You've got GDP, you've got the stock market moving up even though it drops now and then. You've got a great time peace and prosperity.   But their pagan cult religion means has them telling everybody the world is going to hell.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And even Speaker Pelosi today said that look, Trump is trying to goad us into impeaching him. She clearly doesn't want to do it but she might get pushed into it.  I also I'm just reading here that interior commerce and Justice Department staff, of course that's the executive branch, Jesse, they are warned they will have their salaries withheld if they block ongoing committee investigations.  I've been through in a lot of these disputes, I never heard of that. Republicans didn't think about that in Benghazi.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes. Those are some brass knuckle tactics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You've got to give the Democrats credits. I mean, this is political warfare. Why can't we withhold their salaries by the way? I think that should also be an option because they've lied for two years about the president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: They should withhold Trump -- wait. He doesn't take one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right. He donates it to the exact department that people are trying to work for. So, here's what's happening now. Nadler is like a Peeping Tom. It's gotten creepy now. He's peering through the windows, he's looking at people's diaries, rummaging through the garbage. At that point it just gets sick. And he looks weird.  And right now, Mueller spent what, two years looking for something, didn't find a crime. The Democrats can't accept the results of the Mueller report just as they can't accept the results of the 2016 election.  The bottom line is, Dana, is this, without collusion, the scandal is not sexy. You don't have dead bodies. You don't sex. You don't have bribery. You don't have video. You don't have anything compelling. Right now, to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what's right now sexy is contempt of Congress.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. Perfect. So, contempt, attempted obstruction, executive privilege. The American people, they don't have the appetite for that type of scandal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They can only digest so much. I don't even think the American people know who Don McGahn is. I think when I saw in that shoot, I asked 10 people who William Barr is, less than half would know who he has. So right now, we have a new Q poll, Quinnipiac, Juan. The public now opposes impeachment by a 37-point margin. Seventy percent of independents are against the idea but the Democrat base --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They want it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- they want it. So, they need another constitutional crisis so they have to cook up --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- a new crime after the investigation found no crime.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And there was another new poll, Juan. I'm kidding. I would never do that to you. A Gallup poll, though, this was interesting. It shows he's more popular than ever before. This is the number now, 46 percent. And that hits, I think this is where President Obama was at this time in his presidency.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, we went over this yesterday as Jesse --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sorry. Are you sorry, Greg?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: We weren't here yesterday, remember. We got Trump before it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think that's good news for President Trump. I mean, obviously, he's still underwater but, you know, the question is who is moving in those poles. What we see actually is independents aren't moving, slight movement among Democrats. But what you get --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Independent did move one.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, they didn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, they did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let's not argue because I just think the facts are pretty clear.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, they went up from 31 to 39.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No. From -- OK, all right. The point is that when you have what Greg is talking about is a -- I think to myself, who won the last election in terms of popular vote? I think it was a Democrat. Right now, most Americans don't approve, to cite the poll, of Trump's behavior as president of the United States. Even --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: More popular than Obama at this time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Even with the economy up there, this guy still can't get a majority of Americans to approve of his conduct as president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But that number of 46 is, Dagen, I think higher than both what Hillary and Trump were as candidates. Like neither of them ever like broke to 43 I don't think.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: And his approval rating on the economy is much higher because again, this country is so prosperous right now and wages are growing. We can get into this later. Wages are growing faster for production workers. Say, if you work in mining or retail, your wages are growing faster than even supervisory jobs. Because what that does it closes the wealth gap.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, from a low level.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That's --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who gave us that low level, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm just telling you.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Wait, the wages are growing the fastest pace in a decade. That is not something that President Obama could ever do. Decades. I want to add one thing that you brought up Hillary Clinton.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Hillary. Let's talk about Hillary. And we are thankful that she's not the president of the United States and have to listen to that every day, number one. And number two, in terms of all this TV talk show host, how close are we to one of them having a Regan MacNeil moment where they are just so enraged and full of bile that they just spew pieces all over the audience. And then they will understand how we feel having to watch these clips every day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Can I just follow up, though, on the whole business about the war. Because I think there's a big war going on between --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Which war?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- the White House and Congress --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- over these documents. I think, it's very interesting when you, you know, whether people know who Don McGahn is or not. Obviously, he was the White House lawyer that was brought in by Mueller, and apparently, he said to Mueller that Trump had --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: With the blessing and the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. So, but now the White House is saying we're not going to let you have the documents that McGahn had. And you think to yourself, well, how is that possible because some of this is, as you point out, already in the report that's largely been made public. Some of it is redacted. Some of the underlying documents have been kept secret but McGahn is there. So, I don't know how you then go on to claim something like executive privilege. To me, the logic doesn't make sense. It looks like the president is hiding something. He's acting like a guilty man. Because the logic --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think it's really hard to run for reelection saying that you ran for two years on this issue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. What I'm really excited is that CNN is going to have a Comey town hall. And why is that necessary? Why would you have a town hall with James Comey?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You got to -- you've got to keep it alive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: You've got to keep it alive. Because the profit motive for CNN and MSNBC is always going to be conflict. And because they betrayed their audience with the lie of collusion, they have to -- it's like they are at a bar that's running out of booze so now they have watered down booze so Comey is there watered-down booze that they're feeding to their eyeballs who are so pissed off that it didn't worked out that way. So, this is -- it's actually, it's not about Congress. It's not about a battle between Congress and Trump. It's the polarity between media and America. The media is so upset that this narrative collapsed.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What do you say to Chris Wray, the FBI director testifies today, gee, I didn't see any -- there's no evidence of any spying that I'm aware.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's about, well, they are telling me we've got to go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait on that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You can watch that but we can wait on that one. We'll be back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: That noise.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden could have big problems ahead. How liberal can candidates are trying to stop his momentum next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden is surging in the polls but he might want to watch his back because socialist loving candidates are trying to topple his campaign for being too moderate. And these same liberals are now pitching radical proposals to appeal to the base.  Cory Booker is calling for a national gun registry. And watch Senator Spartacus dodging a question about jailing gun owners.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Would you prosecute people? Do you support the government buying them back, and if not, potentially people could go to jail if they don't want to sell them back? Yes or no.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Again, we should have a law that bans these weapons and we should have a reasonable period in which people can turn in these weapons.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris wants to scrap all of President Trump's tax cuts and replace them with this big government handout instead.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: For families that make less than $100,000 a year. I will implement a plan of allowing them to have a tax credit of up to $6,000 a year that they can receive at up to $500 a month.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Bernie Sanders bashing Biden for daring to say he is the most progressive candidate.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I think if you look at Joe's record and you look at my record, I don't think there's much question about who is more progressive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, Dana, this might help Joe Biden, being criticized from the left. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, he is the undisputed front runner by a country mile, like it is undeniable across the board. It is true in all demographics and I don't think it's just name I.D. Right? For a long time, Democrats that were in the race before he got in would say well, people just know his name. But once he got in his numbers went up and they went up again. So, it will be interesting to see how the Democrats decide to start taking him down and who might team up. There's 20 Democrats on -- in the field right now. You see these stories about hunter Biden and the questions about the Ukraine connections and then Biden do anything to help. I don't think those are just being pushed from the right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who do you think leaks that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Who do you think leaked all the touchiness stuff. Who has the most to lose? To me, it's Bernie Sanders. Now he's very amiable in the clip that you just saw there. We didn't show the part where he says I like Joe but his voting record is not mine. And let me tell you what I'm for instead and he makes that contrast pretty well. But right now, especially because of African-American support for Joe Biden, and the southern states that go first in that primary, the race goes through Biden right now. Will he become the nominee? I mean, it's just so early. It's May of 2019.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's so early.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Who knows? But right now, definitely he's the one to beat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And it will be interesting to see how he's going to react to this, Greg. Does he try to appeal to the left and say no, no, no, you know, I am super regressive. Does he hold strong?

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: It's hard because what was the telling point about Biden last week when he was asked if he had a slogan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And couldn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: Right? It's like they asked him the square root --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Make America moral again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. It was like asking the square root of three. He was going, it's 1.372 --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: -- 05080757. I'm from the national gun registry if it's like the bridal registry. So, if you put like -- yes, if you put like I would like a Glock and somebody goes and buys you the Glock. I think a national gun registry is exactly what America needs, to bring us together. We buy each other guns. Look, you have a collection of candidates who want bombers to vote, who want your guns confiscated, who want reparations. These are not candidates for president. They're candidates for evening gigs on MSNBC. It's a platform that's basically a Xerox copy of a media matters newsletter. So, it's really not going to be hard for Biden to look like a centrist. All he has to stand there and not say anything stupid.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Stay --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: But that's the challenge for him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: But the problem is, the big problem is both segments of the Democratic Party are boring. The centrist is boring and even the progressives are boring. All they have is we're not Trump. They need to have their Trump which is somebody that is not merely a politician but somebody that transcends party lines and litmus test, somebody who has some kind of charisma and some danger and some surprise.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that's not going to be Howard Schultz?

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: No, although I like Howie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we love Howie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: I love Howie.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I like Howie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: By the way, how we want Howie to do as much as we can here. Juan, what do you think about this national gun registry situation? You have that. And him refusing -- Cory Booker, Spartacus -- full disclosure. My uncle endorsed Spartacus. I am sure. He say --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: I like how you have to keep disclosing that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why do you have to keep disclosing that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think it's the appropriate thing to say, right? As a journalist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. He also -- he also --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's so funny?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. He also says that he only has one t in his last name. Any time Maxine shows up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. My uncle has not disowned me. All right. So, Juan, if Cory Booker won't answer the question if people are going to go door-to-door and take your guns. Isn't that a little weird?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, he didn't say take your guns. It would be a register.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. But you --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You have to register. So that's the law.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Register and then --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.sentences: At Crate and Barrel.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. So, I think that's a great idea, you know. Because again, it's not gun. You can still own guns. It just means, as most Americans think, we should do a better job of background check and knowing who has guns in the country.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But let me just finish -- let me -- hang on.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You have to register the actual gun owner.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me respond to this. Because one of the realities is that Joe Biden is the big front runner among the Democrats, so to really run against him at this point, you've got to go to his left. That's the wide-open lane right now. But the data shows that Democrats are with Biden which is the exact opposite of all this talk about socialist Democrats, wild-eyed liberals. They like Joe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that what you say too?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I will sum up this very quickly. Joe Biden is plain hard to get. He got in late, he's laying back. And desperate and needy are never a turn on, they're never attractive. And that's what you see from Cory Booker and people who are polling down in the bottom.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. This is a Fox News alert. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo leaving Iraq after making a surprise trip to Baghdad. This comes amid mounting tensions with Iran and news that the U.S. is having an aircraft carrier group to the region. Pompeo meeting with Iraq's primary minister and other officials during a roughly four-hour visit.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Up next, insane video of an unhinged Democrat harassing an elderly woman outside an abortion clinic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The abortion debate is heating up again. A Pennsylvania state representative under fire after confronting a pro-life woman outside a Planned Parenthood clinic in his district. He recorded the entire encounter. Watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Today's protester, now she is an old white lady who is going to try to avoid showing her face. My hope is, is that you'll donate $100 for every extra hour that this woman is out here telling people what's right for their bodies. Who would've thought that an old white lady would be out front of a Planned Parenthood telling people what's right for their bodies? Shame on you. Shame on you for hiding your face at the same time that you're sending other people. Again, the same laws that protect me, protect you. And that's OK. You're allowed to be out here. That doesn't mean that you have a moral right to be out here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The lawmaker defending himself from criticism. He's not the first -- it's not the first time he's done this, though. Three weeks ago, the same lawmaker offered a reward to anyone who would reveal the identities of pro-life teens who are praying outside the clinic.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: To have Pseudo-Christian protesters who've been out here shaming young girls for being here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Hi.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I've got $100 to anyone who will identify any of these three. Because I'm going to donate to Planned Parenthood.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So, we're actually just paying --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Dagen, obviously people are reacting to this, especially on the line pro-life, pro-choice, all that. What do you think, though? I mean, the counterargument would be, well, that's her first amendment right to be there. And his first amendment right to also be there.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes, but this steps over the line, particularly when you go after young women and you're trying to essentially dox them or expose where they live. Because it's, again, this is where how a lot of conservatives feel, that you're not allowed to disagree with the left. And if you disagree with these people who are preaching tolerance but showing intolerance in the name of that, if you disagree with them, they will not just belch bile at you online and spew invective and call you horrible sexist things online. They are going to come for you. They are going to come for you where you are where you are trying to exercise your first amendment rights of expression and they will come for you and your home. This is despicable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Jesse, isn't it the case though, that if we're talking about examples of people being harassed, the bombings and even murders, there's far more examples of this coming from people who are antiabortion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you talking about abortion bombers?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I haven't seen a lot of that recently. And obviously that's violence. This is just atrocious behavior. So, it's apples and oranges.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know, the Democrats don't debate people, Juan, they dox you. They can't have a conversation, they can't persuade, they can't engage. So, instead, they try to shut you down. Conservative speakers on campus shutdown. Conservatives in the media faced boycotts. Conservatives on social media, they get de-platformed and kicked off. The Democrats cannot have an intellectual conversation about most things, especially abortion. And that's why they can't be trusted with power. Because they spy, they de-platform, and they dox. And they don't make distinctions with regards to adults and children either. They went after little girls here. They've gone after Barron Trump in ugly ways. Remember, they did that same thing to the Covington kids. And that's why conservatives have to wake up and realize this is a fight to the teeth with these people. And you have to circle the wagons on principle and defend people on principle when they are targeted like this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, you can talk to me any time, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just listen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.utterance: How is it that the Republican Party, your colleagues, can stand by this man when he is involved in this way with Russia? It seems as though he's unpatriotic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Where to even begin? Greg Gutfeld, let's go to you. McConnell today spoke for the first time really, give a long speech and said case closed, and edition to move on. And then it was funny to watch Chuck Schumer complain about that because move on comes from?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Moveon.org.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which came from the whole point of moving on from the Clinton scandals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: you know, the Dems are desperate. They're like a tiny little army faced with a dwindling patch of turf to defend. Because remember how big the threat was a couple of years ago? Trump was insane, he was racist, he was a threat of the world safety and the economy. Now you've the greatest economy in 50 years, low unemployment. What do they have? What are they clinging to? Tax returns and their feelings are hurt over the Mueller report which they asked for and they got. By the way, if you're going to scream about cover-up and conspiracy, stick to stuff like JFK or space aliens. Not something that's publicly available. It's really hard to call it a cover-up when something is publicly available. You morons. You what this reminds me of? It reminds me of growing up watching the Harlem Globetrotters play the Washington Generals. Right? Trump is the Harlem Globetrotters and the media and the Democrats are the Washington Generals. They can only respond helplessly against the strange phenomenon that continually wins. And they never adjust or adapt to play against the Harlem Globetrotters because they just lose every time. Imagine a group of people cultists who demanded you adhere to their delusions or they will punish you. That's what's going on right now. They are demanding. You, the media, The View, all this morning what's his face, are basically belonging to a pagan religion in which they adhere to some kind of emotional belief that goes against all the facts, low unemployment among minorities, among women. You've got GDP, you've got the stock market moving up even though it drops now and then. You've got a great time peace and prosperity. But their pagan cult religion means has them telling everybody the world is going to hell.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And even Speaker Pelosi today said that look, Trump is trying to goad us into impeaching him. She clearly doesn't want to do it but she might get pushed into it. I also I'm just reading here that interior commerce and Justice Department staff, of course that's the executive branch, Jesse, they are warned they will have their salaries withheld if they block ongoing committee investigations. I've been through in a lot of these disputes, I never heard of that. Republicans didn't think about that in Benghazi.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes. Those are some brass knuckle tactics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You've got to give the Democrats credits. I mean, this is political warfare. Why can't we withhold their salaries by the way? I think that should also be an option because they've lied for two years about the president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: They should withhold Trump -- wait. He doesn't take one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. He donates it to the exact department that people are trying to work for. So, here's what's happening now. Nadler is like a Peeping Tom. It's gotten creepy now. He's peering through the windows, he's looking at people's diaries, rummaging through the garbage. At that point it just gets sick. And he looks weird. And right now, Mueller spent what, two years looking for something, didn't find a crime. The Democrats can't accept the results of the Mueller report just as they can't accept the results of the 2016 election. The bottom line is, Dana, is this, without collusion, the scandal is not sexy. You don't have dead bodies. You don't sex. You don't have bribery. You don't have video. You don't have anything compelling. Right now, to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know what's right now sexy is contempt of Congress.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. Perfect. So, contempt, attempted obstruction, executive privilege. The American people, they don't have the appetite for that type of scandal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They can only digest so much. I don't even think the American people know who Don McGahn is. I think when I saw in that shoot, I asked 10 people who William Barr is, less than half would know who he has. So right now, we have a new Q poll, Quinnipiac, Juan. The public now opposes impeachment by a 37-point margin. Seventy percent of independents are against the idea but the Democrat base --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They want it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- they want it. So, they need another constitutional crisis so they have to cook up --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- a new crime after the investigation found no crime.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And there was another new poll, Juan. I'm kidding. I would never do that to you. A Gallup poll, though, this was interesting. It shows he's more popular than ever before. This is the number now, 46 percent. And that hits, I think this is where President Obama was at this time in his presidency.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, we went over this yesterday as Jesse --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sorry. Are you sorry, Greg?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: We weren't here yesterday, remember. We got Trump before it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I think that's good news for President Trump. I mean, obviously, he's still underwater but, you know, the question is who is moving in those poles. What we see actually is independents aren't moving, slight movement among Democrats. But what you get --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Independent did move one.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, they didn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, they did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let's not argue because I just think the facts are pretty clear.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, they went up from 31 to 39.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. From -- OK, all right. The point is that when you have what Greg is talking about is a -- I think to myself, who won the last election in terms of popular vote? I think it was a Democrat. Right now, most Americans don't approve, to cite the poll, of Trump's behavior as president of the United States. Even --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: More popular than Obama at this time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Even with the economy up there, this guy still can't get a majority of Americans to approve of his conduct as president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But that number of 46 is, Dagen, I think higher than both what Hillary and Trump were as candidates. Like neither of them ever like broke to 43 I don't think.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: And his approval rating on the economy is much higher because again, this country is so prosperous right now and wages are growing. We can get into this later. Wages are growing faster for production workers. Say, if you work in mining or retail, your wages are growing faster than even supervisory jobs. Because what that does it closes the wealth gap.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, from a low level.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That's --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who gave us that low level, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm just telling you.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Wait, the wages are growing the fastest pace in a decade. That is not something that President Obama could ever do. Decades. I want to add one thing that you brought up Hillary Clinton.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Hillary. Let's talk about Hillary. And we are thankful that she's not the president of the United States and have to listen to that every day, number one. And number two, in terms of all this TV talk show host, how close are we to one of them having a Regan MacNeil moment where they are just so enraged and full of bile that they just spew pieces all over the audience. And then they will understand how we feel having to watch these clips every day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Can I just follow up, though, on the whole business about the war. Because I think there's a big war going on between --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Which war?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- the White House and Congress --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- over these documents. I think, it's very interesting when you, you know, whether people know who Don McGahn is or not. Obviously, he was the White House lawyer that was brought in by Mueller, and apparently, he said to Mueller that Trump had --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: With the blessing and the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. So, but now the White House is saying we're not going to let you have the documents that McGahn had. And you think to yourself, well, how is that possible because some of this is, as you point out, already in the report that's largely been made public. Some of it is redacted. Some of the underlying documents have been kept secret but McGahn is there. So, I don't know how you then go on to claim something like executive privilege. To me, the logic doesn't make sense. It looks like the president is hiding something. He's acting like a guilty man. Because the logic --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think it's really hard to run for reelection saying that you ran for two years on this issue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. What I'm really excited is that CNN is going to have a Comey town hall. And why is that necessary? Why would you have a town hall with James Comey?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You got to -- you've got to keep it alive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: You've got to keep it alive. Because the profit motive for CNN and MSNBC is always going to be conflict. And because they betrayed their audience with the lie of collusion, they have to -- it's like they are at a bar that's running out of booze so now they have watered down booze so Comey is there watered-down booze that they're feeding to their eyeballs who are so pissed off that it didn't worked out that way. So, this is -- it's actually, it's not about Congress. It's not about a battle between Congress and Trump. It's the polarity between media and America. The media is so upset that this narrative collapsed.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What do you say to Chris Wray, the FBI director testifies today, gee, I didn't see any -- there's no evidence of any spying that I'm aware.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's about, well, they are telling me we've got to go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait on that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can watch that but we can wait on that one. We'll be back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: That noise.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Joe Biden could have big problems ahead. How liberal can candidates are trying to stop his momentum next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Joe Biden is surging in the polls but he might want to watch his back because socialist loving candidates are trying to topple his campaign for being too moderate. And these same liberals are now pitching radical proposals to appeal to the base. Cory Booker is calling for a national gun registry. And watch Senator Spartacus dodging a question about jailing gun owners.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Would you prosecute people? Do you support the government buying them back, and if not, potentially people could go to jail if they don't want to sell them back? Yes or no.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Again, we should have a law that bans these weapons and we should have a reasonable period in which people can turn in these weapons.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kamala Harris wants to scrap all of President Trump's tax cuts and replace them with this big government handout instead.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: For families that make less than $100,000 a year. I will implement a plan of allowing them to have a tax credit of up to $6,000 a year that they can receive at up to $500 a month.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And Bernie Sanders bashing Biden for daring to say he is the most progressive candidate.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I think if you look at Joe's record and you look at my record, I don't think there's much question about who is more progressive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, Dana, this might help Joe Biden, being criticized from the left. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, he is the undisputed front runner by a country mile, like it is undeniable across the board. It is true in all demographics and I don't think it's just name I.D. Right? For a long time, Democrats that were in the race before he got in would say well, people just know his name. But once he got in his numbers went up and they went up again. So, it will be interesting to see how the Democrats decide to start taking him down and who might team up. There's 20 Democrats on -- in the field right now. You see these stories about hunter Biden and the questions about the Ukraine connections and then Biden do anything to help. I don't think those are just being pushed from the right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who do you think leaks that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who do you think leaked all the touchiness stuff. Who has the most to lose? To me, it's Bernie Sanders. Now he's very amiable in the clip that you just saw there. We didn't show the part where he says I like Joe but his voting record is not mine. And let me tell you what I'm for instead and he makes that contrast pretty well. But right now, especially because of African-American support for Joe Biden, and the southern states that go first in that primary, the race goes through Biden right now. Will he become the nominee? I mean, it's just so early. It's May of 2019.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's so early.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who knows? But right now, definitely he's the one to beat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it will be interesting to see how he's going to react to this, Greg. Does he try to appeal to the left and say no, no, no, you know, I am super regressive. Does he hold strong?

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: It's hard because what was the telling point about Biden last week when he was asked if he had a slogan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And couldn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: Right? It's like they asked him the square root --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Make America moral again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. It was like asking the square root of three. He was going, it's 1.372 --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: -- 05080757. I'm from the national gun registry if it's like the bridal registry. So, if you put like -- yes, if you put like I would like a Glock and somebody goes and buys you the Glock. I think a national gun registry is exactly what America needs, to bring us together. We buy each other guns. Look, you have a collection of candidates who want bombers to vote, who want your guns confiscated, who want reparations. These are not candidates for president. They're candidates for evening gigs on MSNBC. It's a platform that's basically a Xerox copy of a media matters newsletter. So, it's really not going to be hard for Biden to look like a centrist. All he has to stand there and not say anything stupid.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Stay --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: But that's the challenge for him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: But the problem is, the big problem is both segments of the Democratic Party are boring. The centrist is boring and even the progressives are boring. All they have is we're not Trump. They need to have their Trump which is somebody that is not merely a politician but somebody that transcends party lines and litmus test, somebody who has some kind of charisma and some danger and some surprise.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And that's not going to be Howard Schultz?

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: No, although I like Howie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, we love Howie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: I love Howie.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like Howie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: By the way, how we want Howie to do as much as we can here. Juan, what do you think about this national gun registry situation? You have that. And him refusing -- Cory Booker, Spartacus -- full disclosure. My uncle endorsed Spartacus. I am sure. He say --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: I like how you have to keep disclosing that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why do you have to keep disclosing that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think it's the appropriate thing to say, right? As a journalist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. He also -- he also --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's so funny?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. He also says that he only has one t in his last name. Any time Maxine shows up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. My uncle has not disowned me. All right. So, Juan, if Cory Booker won't answer the question if people are going to go door-to-door and take your guns. Isn't that a little weird?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, he didn't say take your guns. It would be a register.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. But you --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You have to register. So that's the law.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Register and then --

utterances.speaker: GUTFIELD
utterances.utterance: At Crate and Barrel.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. So, I think that's a great idea, you know. Because again, it's not gun. You can still own guns. It just means, as most Americans think, we should do a better job of background check and knowing who has guns in the country.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But let me just finish -- let me -- hang on.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You have to register the actual gun owner.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me respond to this. Because one of the realities is that Joe Biden is the big front runner among the Democrats, so to really run against him at this point, you've got to go to his left. That's the wide-open lane right now. But the data shows that Democrats are with Biden which is the exact opposite of all this talk about socialist Democrats, wild-eyed liberals. They like Joe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is that what you say too?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I will sum up this very quickly. Joe Biden is plain hard to get. He got in late, he's laying back. And desperate and needy are never a turn on, they're never attractive. And that's what you see from Cory Booker and people who are polling down in the bottom.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. This is a Fox News alert. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo leaving Iraq after making a surprise trip to Baghdad. This comes amid mounting tensions with Iran and news that the U.S. is having an aircraft carrier group to the region. Pompeo meeting with Iraq's primary minister and other officials during a roughly four-hour visit.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Up next, insane video of an unhinged Democrat harassing an elderly woman outside an abortion clinic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The abortion debate is heating up again. A Pennsylvania state representative under fire after confronting a pro-life woman outside a Planned Parenthood clinic in his district. He recorded the entire encounter. Watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Today's protester, now she is an old white lady who is going to try to avoid showing her face. My hope is, is that you'll donate $100 for every extra hour that this woman is out here telling people what's right for their bodies. Who would've thought that an old white lady would be out front of a Planned Parenthood telling people what's right for their bodies? Shame on you. Shame on you for hiding your face at the same time that you're sending other people. Again, the same laws that protect me, protect you. And that's OK. You're allowed to be out here. That doesn't mean that you have a moral right to be out here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The lawmaker defending himself from criticism. He's not the first -- it's not the first time he's done this, though. Three weeks ago, the same lawmaker offered a reward to anyone who would reveal the identities of pro-life teens who are praying outside the clinic.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: To have Pseudo-Christian protesters who've been out here shaming young girls for being here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Hi.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I've got $100 to anyone who will identify any of these three. Because I'm going to donate to Planned Parenthood.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: So, we're actually just paying --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Dagen, obviously people are reacting to this, especially on the line pro-life, pro-choice, all that. What do you think, though? I mean, the counterargument would be, well, that's her first amendment right to be there. And his first amendment right to also be there.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, but this steps over the line, particularly when you go after young women and you're trying to essentially dox them or expose where they live. Because it's, again, this is where how a lot of conservatives feel, that you're not allowed to disagree with the left. And if you disagree with these people who are preaching tolerance but showing intolerance in the name of that, if you disagree with them, they will not just belch bile at you online and spew invective and call you horrible sexist things online. They are going to come for you. They are going to come for you where you are where you are trying to exercise your first amendment rights of expression and they will come for you and your home. This is despicable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Jesse, isn't it the case though, that if we're talking about examples of people being harassed, the bombings and even murders, there's far more examples of this coming from people who are antiabortion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are you talking about abortion bombers?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I haven't seen a lot of that recently. And obviously that's violence. This is just atrocious behavior. So, it's apples and oranges.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, the Democrats don't debate people, Juan, they dox you. They can't have a conversation, they can't persuade, they can't engage. So, instead, they try to shut you down. Conservative speakers on campus shutdown. Conservatives in the media faced boycotts. Conservatives on social media, they get de-platformed and kicked off. The Democrats cannot have an intellectual conversation about most things, especially abortion. And that's why they can't be trusted with power. Because they spy, they de-platform, and they dox. And they don't make distinctions with regards to adults and children either. They went after little girls here. They've gone after Barron Trump in ugly ways. Remember, they did that same thing to the Covington kids. And that's why conservatives have to wake up and realize this is a fight to the teeth with these people. And you have to circle the wagons on principle and defend people on principle when they are targeted like this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you can talk to me any time, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just listen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Listen --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You show up -- you show up at my house with a cell phone taking video of me, pavement dive.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: My gosh. I'm scared. Dana, what we see in reality here, Governor O'Brian Camp of Georgia has just signed a six week abortion law. And we have three other states that have done so similarly; Kentucky, Mississippi, Ohio. And the counterargument would be some people don't even know they're pregnant six weeks in.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Well, first of all, those legislatures are passing those laws. So, people voted for their state Representative and state Senator and those Representatives of that democratically elected state literature voted and a Governor signed it, legal. And if you win elections, you get to pass laws. So there's that. The thing about this guy is that he thinks that that woman who by the way, the woman he was attacking, will be on Tucker Carlson Tonight. So, how do you think that's going to work out for you? Because she wasn't shaming people. If you can't tell the difference between shaming people and praying for life, you will never win another election.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Okay. Well, I think there are lots of arguments there, but Greg, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Dana, what is the biblical term for - when you describe a mule? What's the word?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, Gosh! Well, I don't know -- my biblical--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's another word for mule?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Donkey?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, or--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Say it, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: An ass?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What it is called?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: An ass.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: An ass. And then, what's that word for what you dig with a shovel?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Dig?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, what you dig, what are you digging?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What is going on here?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A hole?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Now take those words and put them together, that's what he is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I got it. Sorry, I'm so afraid of mocking myself.

That is South of Denver, past Littleton, Colorado, where Columbine High School is, and then the next community is Highlands Ranch. The Sheriff's department just gives us an update. They originally said two victims. Now we know there were seven and possibly eight. It happened in the middle school section of the school. It's a K-12 place, but it was in the middle school building. Two juvenile suspects are now in custody. The sheriff says they are both juveniles. They don't know if they're students at that school. But two are in custody. The sheriff had reported that they were looking for a possible third suspect. They no longer believe there was a third suspect. The school administrators reported shots fired. Officers arrived within minutes. They're still going door-to-door at the school. So, it's somewhat of an active scene. But they believe at least that the danger to students has passed. Again an active scene Highlands Ranch, Colorado; two suspects are in custody. THE FIVE will continue after this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: But it's not. Hold on a second, but it's not. For your average American at home, there are not space aliens coming out and saying we're going to take you over. This is an intangible.

utterances.utterance: You think that's bad, watch CNN ratcheting up the rhetoric.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: As for our rapidly dwindling biodiversity, these experts claim it's the 11th hour. We must act now. Consuming less or using less, having fewer children.

utterances.utterance: Yes, they would.

utterances.utterance: Build a wall around planet Dana.

utterances.utterance: Yes, I think they are invading. I think we better send the military to the southern border because they're sure to come through Mexico.

utterances.utterance: I actually did some research because I'm trying to keep up with Greg on the research front. And we found some wrong doomsday predictions from the so-called experts. utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well you know that, the great thing about a free market is you can experiment in small markets and see if it works.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. Because why Hickenlooper who is now running for President tells all of the states, don't do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Alright, well maybe he's wrong.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.utterance: Alright.

utterances.utterance: Thank you. One More Thing is up next.

Stephan, who graduated said, that moment tops every other moment he has shared with his mom. What a wonderful story.
